column1: Bavette's Bar & Boeuf////We were excited to try Bavette's because of the great reviews. I was neutral on the decor when we first arrived (dark
column3: retro). So excited to see foie gras as an appetizer...and it was great. The Lyonnaise salad was exceptional
column4: the best part of our meal. Then the entrees. My husband ordered a ribeye and I ordered a pork chop. Both of us thought that our meat was on the dry & tough side. As far as the pork goes
column5: the cut was so thick that it was probably difficult to get the inside done w/o overcooking the outer meat. I'm not sure what happened with the steak. Anyway
